intro: Mesembryanthemum curtum, commonly known as the Cape groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry conditions. It produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, often blooming in late summer to early autumn. Mesembryanthemum curtum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its drought tolerance and aesthetic qualities.
